title: Drawing, Three Designs for Candlesticks, 1803
medium: pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, traces of graphite on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and ink, upper left: No 3 / Scudi 300; in pen and ink, upper center: No 4 / Scudi 600 / Tutto dorato sc 800; in pen and ink, upper right: No 5 / Scudi 300 [corrected over 250] / Tutto dorato sc 300; in pen and ink, in line with scale at bottom: Scala . . .3 di Palmi Romani; in pen and ink, bottom right: Anno 1803
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Three designs for candlesticks, all supported by lion feet. At left, the bottom part of the shaft consists of acanthus scrolls, worked à jour, showing inside a standing escutcheon. A foliated, scalloped and fluted balustrade supporting the bowl with the socket from the top part. At center, the shafts consisting of seated griffins, worked à jour, connected by festoons and flanking a papal escutcheon. On them stands a base upon which the animals of the Evangelists support the sphere upon which are shown the allegorical figures of Justice or Strength, Faith, and Love. A calyx rises over them, supporting the bowl and socket. At right, a calyx supports a baluster, the bottom part of which is covered by a calyx, from which vine stem rises. The top is similar to other designs. A scale at bottom. Two framing lines at bottom, partly cut off.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Three Designs for Candlesticks, 1803; Italy; pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, traces of graphite on off-white laid paper; 34.3 × 42.1 cm (13 1/2 × 16 9/16 in.); Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund; 1938-88-625
